<div id="data_types" class="registered_link"></div>

In the context of compatibility with Postgres, Oracle data types fall into three categories:

- Oracle data types that map to native PostgreSQL data types.
- Oracle data types that are implemented in EDB Postgres Advanced Server.
- Oracle data types that aren't applicable to Postgres.

In this list of Oracle data types, we provide a brief definition of the data type and a link to appropriate documentation for those data types that are applicable to Postgres. 

| Oracle Data Type                                                          | Description |
|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------|
| BFILE                                                                     |             |
| BINARY_DOUBLE                                                             |             |
| BINARY_FLOAT                                                              |             |
| BLOB, LONG RAW, RAW(size)                                                 | EDB Postgres Advanced Server implements as BYTEA. See [Binary data](/epas/latest/epas_compat_reference/02_the_sql_language/02_data_types/03_binary_data.).            |
| CHAR [(size [BYTE \| CHAR])]                                              | Maps to PostgreSQL [character types](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/datatype-character.html).              |
| CLOB                                                                      | EDB Postgres Advanced Server implements as CLOB. See [CLOB](/epas/14/epas_compat_reference/02_the_sql_language/02_data_types/02_character_types/#clob).            |
| DATE                                                                      |             |
| FLOAT [(p)]                                                               |             |
| INTERVAL DAY [(day_precision)] TO SECOND [(fractional_seconds_precision)] |             |
| INTERVAL YEAR [(year_precision)] TO MONTH                                 |             |
| LONG                                                                      |             |
| NCHAR[(size)]                                                             |             |
| NCLOB                                                                     |             |
| NUMBER [ (p [, s]) ]                                                      |             |
| NVARCHAR2(size)                                                           |             |
| ROWID                                                                     |             |
| TIMESTAMP [(fractional_seconds_precision)]                                |             |
| TIMESTAMP [(fractional_seconds_precision)] WITH LOCAL TIME ZONE           |             |
| TIMESTAMP [(fractional_seconds_precision)] WITH TIME ZONE                 |             |
| UROWID [(size)]                                                           |             |
| VARCHAR2(size [BYTE \| CHAR])                                             | EDB Postgres Advanced Server implements as CHARACTER VARYING(n). See [VARCHAR, VARCHAR2, NVARCHAR and NVARCHAR2](/epas/14/epas_compat_reference/02_the_sql_language/02_data_types/02_character_types.mdx#varchar-varchar2-nvarchar-and-nvarchar2) |
